Rep. Mike Pence arrived at Columbus in his east-central Indiana district for a town hall meeting, the sort of event that usually attracted a few dozen constituents. Surprised to see the hallway outside the room crowded with people, their arms folded and brows furrowed, Mike Pence shouted down the hall to an aide, asking him to get a janitor to open the room. For whatever reason, the administration never made public these facts about an active WMD production facility run by terrorists in Iraq, Rumsfeld wrote.
